compress-pdf.p2: PDF 파일을 업로드하면 Tuttilo의 압축 엔진이 각 페이지를 분석하여 크기 축소 기회를 식별합니다. 이 도구는 텍스트 명확성과 시각적 충실도를 유지하면서 이미지, 글꼴 및 포함된 콘텐츠에 지능형 최적화를 적용합니다. 파일 크기 또는 최대 품질의 우선순위에 따라 다양한 압축 수준 중에서 선택할 수 있습니다. 모든 것이 브라우저에서 실행되므로 재무 보고서나 법적 계약과 같은 민감한 문서는 절대 외부 서버에 도달하지 않으므로 압축 프로세스 중에 완전한 개인 정보 보호가 보장됩니다.
compress-pdf.p3: 학생들은 엄격한 파일 크기 제한이 있는 대학 포털을 통해 제출하기 전에 연구 논문과 논문 초안을 압축하는 데 이 도구를 자주 사용합니다. 마케팅 전문가는 첨부 파일 크기 제한을 초과하지 않고 이메일 배포를 위해 프레젠테이션 자료와 제품 카탈로그를 축소하는 데 의존합니다. 부동산 중개인은 고객과 포트폴리오를 공유할 때 빠른 로딩 시간을 보장하기 위해 부동산 브로셔와 목록 문서를 압축합니다. 법무 부서는 엄격한 크기 제한을 부과하는 법원 전자 제출 시스템에 업로드하기 전에 계약 번들과 사례 파일의 크기를 줄이는 데 사용합니다.
compress-pdf.p4: 최적의 결과를 얻으려면 고해상도 사진이나 스캔한 이미지가 포함된 PDF를 압축하세요. 60-80%의 크기 축소가 일반적입니다. 주로 텍스트와 벡터 그래픽이 있는 문서는 이미 효율적으로 저장되어 있으므로 개선이 더 작을 수 있습니다. 품질 저하가 각 패스와 함께 누적되므로 동일한 파일을 여러 번 압축하지 마세요. 전문 인쇄를 위해 정확한 색상 충실도를 보존해야 하는 경우 전체 문서를 압축하기 전에 먼저 샘플 페이지를 테스트하세요. 두 가지 버전을 만드는 것을 고려하세요. 디지털 배포용으로 압축된 버전과 보관 목적으로 압축되지 않은 마스터 버전입니다.

pdf-organizer.p2: PDF 파일을 업로드하면 각 페이지의 축소판 미리보기가 표시되어 드래그 앤 드롭으로 쉽게 재정렬할 수 있습니다. 원하지 않는 페이지를 제거하고, 여러 PDF의 특정 페이지를 하나의 통합 문서로 결합하거나, 큰 파일을 더 작은 섹션으로 분할할 수 있습니다. 모든 페이지 조작은 브라우저 내에서 로컬로 처리되므로 민감한 문서가 서버에 업로드되지 않습니다. 정리가 완료되면 새로 구조화된 PDF를 즉시 다운로드할 수 있습니다.
pdf-organizer.p3: 연구원들은 여러 소스의 관련 페이지를 하나의 참고 문서로 결합하기 위해 이 도구를 사용합니다. 교사들은 수업 자료를 재정렬하거나 학생 과제에서 불필요한 페이지를 제거합니다. 행정 직원은 제출하기 전에 양식 묶음을 올바른 순서로 정렬합니다. 법률 전문가들은 법원 제출을 위해 증거 문서를 구성하고 관련 없는 섹션을 삭제합니다. 프리랜서들은 여러 프로젝트에서 포트폴리오 샘플을 하나의 전문적인 프레젠테이션으로 병합합니다.
pdf-organizer.p4: 최상의 성능을 위해 페이지 수가 100페이지 미만인 PDF로 작업하세요. 더 큰 문서는 작동하지만 페이지 축소판을 렌더링하는 데 시간이 더 걸릴 수 있습니다. 대규모 재정렬을 수행할 때는 여러 페이지를 한 번에 선택하여 그룹으로 이동하세요. 원본 파일에 양식 필드나 주석이 포함된 경우 대부분의 조작에서 보존되지만 복잡한 재구성 후에는 항상 테스트하세요. 법적 또는 규정 준수 목적으로 원본 페이지 순서를 문서화해야 하는 경우 정리하기 전에 원본 PDF의 백업 사본을 보관하세요.

pdf-word.p2: Drag a PDF file to convert it into an editable DOCX document, preserving text formatting, tables, and basic layout structure. The tool analyzes PDF content and reconstructs it as native Word elements rather than embedded images, allowing you to modify text, adjust formatting, and reflow content. Converting in the opposite direction creates PDFs from Word files while maintaining fonts, styles, and page structure. The bidirectional conversion runs entirely within your browser using client-side processing libraries, ensuring documents containing proprietary information or confidential data never leave your computer.
pdf-word.p3: Freelance writers convert client-provided PDF briefs into Word documents to add tracked changes and editorial comments during the revision process. HR managers transform PDF job descriptions into editable templates for creating new position postings with updated requirements. Consultants convert proposal PDFs received from partners into Word format to merge sections and customize content for specific clients. Academic administrators turn PDF course syllabi into editable Word files for faculty to update semester schedules and reading lists. Small business owners convert vendor contracts from PDF to Word to mark up terms before sending to legal review.
pdf-word.p4: PDF-to-Word conversion works best with text-based documents rather than scanned images, which require OCR processing separately. Complex layouts with multiple columns, text boxes, or intricate graphics may require manual formatting adjustments after conversion. Before converting important documents, check that all special characters and symbols transferred correctly, particularly mathematical notation or foreign language text. When creating PDFs from Word, use high-quality settings if the document contains detailed charts or diagrams. Save converted files under new names to preserve the original in case you need to reference the source formatting.

pdf-editor.p2: Load your PDF and click anywhere on the page to insert new text with automatic font and size matching to blend seamlessly with existing content. The tool detects fonts already used in the document and attempts to replicate them, though complex or proprietary fonts fall back to standard alternatives. Beyond text editing, you can draw freehand annotations, highlight passages, and add shapes or arrows for visual markup. All editing operations modify a copy of your document locally in the browser, leaving the original file unchanged on your device until you explicitly download the edited version.
pdf-editor.p3: Property managers fill in tenant information on standardized lease agreement templates without printing and rescanning. Educators annotate student essay PDFs with margin comments and correction marks before returning graded assignments. Construction supervisors markup architectural plans with revision notes and measurement corrections for contractor teams. Medical office staff add patient appointment details and insurance codes to blank intake form templates. Event planners edit venue contract PDFs to insert specific dates, attendee counts, and customized catering requirements before submitting to suppliers.
pdf-editor.p4: For best font matching, stick to common typefaces like Arial, Helvetica, or Times New Roman that are universally available across systems. When adding substantial new text, check that line spacing and alignment match surrounding content to avoid obvious visual inconsistencies. Use the drawing tools sparingly on text-heavy documents to prevent obscuring important information—lighter colors and thinner lines work better for annotations. If font matching fails, consider replacing entire text blocks rather than mixing mismatched fonts within paragraphs. Always preview the final page before downloading to catch alignment issues or text overflow that may not be obvious during editing.

pdf-fill-sign.p2: Click on any form field to type responses directly into text boxes, checkboxes, and dropdown menus without printing the document. The signature feature lets you draw your signature using a mouse or trackpad, type your name in script font, or upload an image of your handwritten signature saved from a previous signing. Position signatures and initials precisely where required by dragging them to the appropriate lines. Since form filling and signing happen entirely in your browser, sensitive information like social security numbers, bank account details, or medical data never gets transmitted to external servers during the process.
pdf-fill-sign.p3: Remote employees sign employment contracts, non-disclosure agreements, and direct deposit authorization forms for new jobs without printing or mailing physical paperwork. Parents complete school permission slips, emergency contact forms, and field trip waivers electronically before deadlines. Loan applicants fill out mortgage pre-qualification forms and sign disclosure documents from home instead of visiting bank branches. Medical patients complete intake questionnaires and HIPAA consent forms before telehealth appointments. Freelancers sign client service agreements and project proposals while negotiating terms via email, eliminating delays from postal delivery.
pdf-fill-sign.p4: Create a reusable signature image once and save it separately for quick insertion into future documents rather than redrawing each time. Before signing important contracts, read the entire document carefully—the convenience of digital signing shouldn't rush critical decisions. For forms with many fields, tab through entries systematically to avoid skipping required information that could invalidate the submission. If a signature looks pixelated or unclear after placement, redraw it at a larger size before shrinking to fit the signature line. Save a copy of the completed form before submitting it to maintain your own records of what was signed and when.

pdf-images.p2: Converting PDFs to images extracts each page as a separate high-resolution JPG or PNG file, useful for sharing specific pages on social media or embedding in presentations. Going the other direction, you can select multiple image files to combine them into a single multi-page PDF with each photo appearing on its own page. Choose output quality and resolution settings to balance file size against image clarity based on your intended use. The bidirectional conversion happens entirely in your browser, so vacation photos, design mockups, or business graphics remain private throughout the transformation process.
pdf-images.p3: Graphic designers convert finished PDF mockups into PNG images with transparent backgrounds for client presentations and portfolio websites. Social media managers extract infographic pages from multi-page PDF reports to share as individual Instagram posts or Twitter cards. E-commerce sellers combine product photos into PDF catalogs for wholesale buyers to download complete collections. Real estate photographers merge property images into PDF showing packages for listing agents to share with potential buyers. Students convert lecture slide PDFs into individual images to insert specific diagrams into research papers and study guides.
pdf-images.p4: Use PNG output format when you need transparent backgrounds or sharp text clarity, while JPG works better for photographs where smaller file sizes matter more than perfect quality. When creating PDFs from images, arrange files in the correct order before conversion since reordering afterward requires additional tools. For scanned documents being converted to PDF, ensure consistent image orientation beforehand to avoid mixed portrait and landscape pages. If converting PDFs with complex graphics or gradients to images, choose higher DPI settings to prevent visible pixelation in the output. Consider compression settings carefully when batch converting multiple pages—very high quality can produce unwieldy file sizes.

pdf-excel.p2: Upload a PDF containing tables and the tool analyzes page layout to identify columnar data, reconstructing it as native Excel cells with preserved row and column alignment. Text-based PDFs with clear table structures convert most reliably, while scanned documents may require OCR processing first for accurate data extraction. Converting from Excel to PDF transforms spreadsheets into fixed-layout documents that display consistently across devices, maintaining formulas as calculated values and preserving cell formatting. All conversion processing runs locally in your browser, keeping financial statements, sales reports, and budget spreadsheets private on your device.
pdf-excel.p3: Financial analysts convert quarterly earnings report PDFs from public companies into Excel format to build comparison models and perform ratio analysis. Small business owners transform scanned receipt images into Excel expense logs for bookkeeping and tax preparation. Marketing teams convert campaign performance PDFs from advertising platforms into editable spreadsheets for custom chart creation. Supply chain managers extract inventory data tables from vendor PDF catalogs into Excel for sorting, filtering, and reorder calculations. Researchers convert statistical tables from published journal article PDFs into Excel datasets for meta-analysis and replication studies.
pdf-excel.p4: Table detection works best when PDF data is organized in clear rows and columns with consistent spacing—merged cells and complex nested structures may require manual cleanup after conversion. Before converting important financial data, verify that numbers transferred correctly and formulas didn't get lost, especially for percentages and currency formats. When creating PDFs from Excel, freeze header rows and adjust page breaks beforehand to ensure tables don't split awkwardly across pages. If a PDF contains multiple separate tables, consider extracting them into individual Excel sheets rather than one combined worksheet. Test converted files by spot-checking several data points against the original to catch any extraction errors early.

pdf-pptx.p2: Load a PDF to convert each page into an individual PowerPoint slide, allowing you to extract presentation content for editing and customization. The tool attempts to preserve text, images, and layout positioning, though complex PDF designs may require adjustment in PowerPoint after conversion. Going the reverse direction, PPTX files become fixed-layout PDFs suitable for distribution when you want to prevent recipients from altering slides or when presenting on systems without PowerPoint installed. All conversion happens in your browser using client-side processing, so proprietary business presentations and confidential pitch decks never upload to external servers.
pdf-pptx.p3: Sales teams convert competitor pitch decks received as PDFs into editable PowerPoint format to analyze messaging strategies and visual approaches. Conference speakers transform submitted PDF presentation files into PPTX to add custom branding and speaker notes before delivering talks. Training coordinators convert educational PDF modules into PowerPoint to incorporate interactive quizzes and discussion prompts for live workshops. Marketing agencies transform client-provided PDF brand guidelines into PowerPoint templates for creating consistent promotional materials. Consultants convert proposal PDFs from one client into reusable PowerPoint slide libraries for customizing future pitches to similar industries.
pdf-pptx.p4: PDF-to-PowerPoint conversion works most reliably on presentations originally created in slide software rather than complex multi-column documents designed for printing. After conversion, check that images maintained proper resolution and alignment, especially logos and charts that need to stay pixel-perfect. When creating PDFs from PowerPoint, use high-quality export settings if slides contain detailed diagrams or photographs that will be viewed on large displays. Embedded videos and animations won't transfer during conversion—note their positions and re-add them manually if needed. If you're converting to modify a few slides, consider editing just those pages as images rather than converting the entire presentation.

html-to-pdf.p2: Paste HTML code directly into the editor and the tool renders it as a visual page before converting to PDF format. CSS styling and basic layout elements are preserved, allowing you to transform web content, email templates, or code snippets into shareable documents. This is particularly useful for archiving web pages, creating printable versions of online content, or generating reports from HTML-formatted data. The conversion processes entirely in your browser, so HTML containing proprietary information or embedded sensitive data never leaves your computer during PDF generation.
html-to-pdf.p3: Web developers convert HTML email templates into PDF mockups for client approval before coding final responsive versions. Bloggers archive important web articles as PDFs to preserve formatting and content that might change or disappear from original sources. Data analysts convert HTML reports generated by analytics scripts into PDF format for distribution to stakeholders who prefer static documents. Legal teams save HTML-formatted contract drafts as PDFs to create timestamped records of agreement versions during negotiation. Teachers convert interactive HTML tutorials into printable PDF study guides for students without reliable internet access.
html-to-pdf.p4: Keep HTML relatively simple for best conversion results—complex JavaScript, external stylesheets, and intricate CSS frameworks may not render perfectly in the PDF output. Inline CSS styles directly in your HTML rather than linking external files to ensure formatting transfers correctly. Test that images referenced in your HTML are accessible; broken image links will appear as placeholders in the final PDF. For multi-page content, use explicit page break CSS properties to control where pages divide rather than letting the converter decide automatically. If your HTML contains interactive elements like forms or buttons, remember these won't function in the static PDF—consider removing or replacing them with equivalent static content first.

unlock-pdf.p2: Upload a password-protected PDF and if you have the correct password, the tool removes restrictions that prevent printing, copying, or editing. Some PDFs have user passwords (required to open the file) while others have owner passwords (that restrict permissions)—this tool handles both types when credentials are provided. The unlocking process strips security metadata and creates an unrestricted copy of the document. All processing occurs locally in your browser, so documents containing confidential information remain on your device and passwords aren't transmitted to any server during the unlock operation.
unlock-pdf.p3: Remote workers unlock company PDF documents received with outdated passwords to enable copying text for reports after the original document creator left the organization. Researchers remove printing restrictions from archived journal articles to create physical reference copies for offline study. Legal assistants unlock case file PDFs to enable text selection and copying when extracting quotes for briefs and motions. Small business owners remove editing restrictions from vendor-supplied PDF forms to customize fields and branding for their specific operations. Archivists unlock historical PDF documents where original passwords are documented in institutional records but restrictions prevent digital preservation workflows.
unlock-pdf.p4: This tool only removes restrictions from PDFs where you already have access—it cannot crack or bypass unknown passwords, which would violate security protections. If you frequently receive protected documents from the same source, request unrestricted versions to avoid repetitive unlocking. Before unlocking documents for editing, verify you have legal authority to modify them since some restrictions are intentionally placed to prevent unauthorized changes. Save unlocked versions under clearly labeled filenames to distinguish them from the original protected copies. Remember that removing protection doesn't enhance document quality or repair corrupted files—it only eliminates access restrictions.

pdf-protect.p2: Set a user password to require authentication before anyone can open your PDF, preventing unauthorized viewing of confidential content. Configure owner password controls to restrict specific actions like printing, copying text, editing pages, or form filling even after the document is opened. The tool encrypts your PDF and embeds permission flags recognized by PDF readers, enforcing restrictions on compliant software. All password protection and encryption happens locally in your browser, ensuring sensitive documents and passwords never transmit to external servers during the security process.
pdf-protect.p3: Law firms protect client case documents with passwords before sharing via email to ensure only intended recipients can view privileged communications. HR departments restrict copying and editing on employee handbook PDFs to prevent unauthorized modifications to company policies. Financial advisors password-protect retirement planning documents sent to clients containing social security numbers and account details. Consultants protect proprietary methodology guides and strategic reports to prevent clients from redistributing intellectual property. Healthcare providers restrict printing on patient medical record PDFs to maintain HIPAA compliance when sharing via secure portals.
pdf-protect.p4: Use strong, unique passwords combining letters, numbers, and symbols rather than simple phrases that are easy to guess or crack. Document your passwords securely in a password manager—losing the password to an important encrypted PDF can make data permanently inaccessible. Consider whether you need user password protection (prevents opening) or just permission restrictions (allows viewing but limits actions) based on your security requirements. Test protected PDFs on different PDF readers to verify restrictions work as expected, since enforcement varies across software. If sharing password-protected files, communicate passwords through a separate channel from the document itself to maintain security if one channel is compromised.

pdf-flatten.p2: Flattening converts all interactive form fields, annotations, and comments into static page content that becomes part of the permanent document image. After flattening, text previously entered in fillable fields can no longer be edited, dropdown selections become fixed text, and annotation layers merge into the background. This process is irreversible, so the tool creates a new flattened copy while preserving your original file. All flattening happens in your browser, keeping documents containing completed personal information or business data private on your device throughout the transformation.
pdf-flatten.p3: Government agencies flatten completed application forms before archiving to prevent accidental data modification in official records. Legal departments flatten signed contracts after execution to ensure terms cannot be altered during storage and future reference. HR teams flatten completed employee onboarding forms to create permanent personnel file records that prevent subsequent editing. Financial institutions flatten loan applications containing customer signatures to maintain unalterable records for compliance audits. Educational administrators flatten student enrollment forms with parent signatures to preserve official registration documentation that cannot be tampered with.
pdf-flatten.p4: Always verify that all required fields are completed correctly before flattening, since you cannot edit form data afterward without recreating the entire document. Flatten documents after collecting final signatures but before long-term archiving to prevent format compatibility issues with future PDF software versions. If you need to maintain an editable version for updates, save the original separately before flattening and clearly label which file is the permanent record. Flattening also locks down annotations and comments, so ensure all reviewer feedback has been addressed before making changes permanent. Check that flattened documents display correctly across different PDF viewers, as some complex form elements may render slightly differently after merging into page content.

pdf-crop.p2: Adjust margin sliders to trim white space or remove unwanted borders from all pages simultaneously, creating a more compact document with larger content relative to page size. The visual preview shows exactly what area will be retained, letting you fine-tune crop boundaries before applying changes. This is especially useful for PDFs that were scanned with excessive margins or documents where binding margins need removal for digital distribution. All cropping calculations happen in your browser, keeping documents containing sensitive diagrams or proprietary content private on your device during the margin adjustment process.
pdf-crop.p3: Architects crop construction drawings to remove title block margins when sending detail views to subcontractors who only need specific sections. Students trim scanned textbook pages to eliminate page numbers and headers, maximizing content size for tablet reading. Graphic designers crop presentation PDFs to remove placeholder margins added during template creation. Researchers crop journal article scans to eliminate library watermarks and binding margins for cleaner personal reference files. Publishers crop submitted manuscript PDFs to remove author contact information and metadata before sending to anonymous peer reviewers.
pdf-crop.p4: Preview the crop on several representative pages before applying to ensure you're not accidentally trimming important content from pages with varying layouts. For documents with intentional margin differences across pages (like wider binding edges), cropping uniformly may cut off content on some pages while leaving excess margin on others. If you need to crop different pages differently, consider splitting the PDF first, cropping sections separately, then merging them back together. Leave slightly more margin than the minimum to account for printer tolerances if the cropped PDF will eventually be printed. Check that page numbers, footnotes, or headers aren't positioned in margins you're removing—they'll disappear after cropping.

pdf-compare.p2: Upload two versions of the same document and the tool displays them side by side with synchronized scrolling for visual inspection. A difference analysis runs pixel-level comparison to identify modified text, added content, deleted sections, and formatting changes between versions. The tool calculates an overall difference percentage and highlights changed areas, making it easy to spot revisions quickly. All comparison processing happens locally in your browser, so confidential contract drafts or proprietary document versions never leave your device during the analysis.
pdf-compare.p3: Legal teams compare contract draft versions to verify all requested changes were implemented before client signing. Quality assurance reviewers compare training manual revisions to ensure updated procedures replaced outdated instructions correctly. Compliance officers compare policy document versions to identify what changed between annual reviews for change log documentation. Editors compare manuscript draft iterations to confirm author revisions addressed all editorial feedback. Financial auditors compare report versions to trace when and where discrepancies were introduced during document preparation.
pdf-compare.p4: For most accurate comparison, ensure both PDFs are the same page size and orientation—misaligned pages will show false differences even if content is identical. Text-based PDFs compare more reliably than scanned images where slight scan variations can trigger false positive differences. When reviewing comparison results, focus on meaningful content changes rather than minor rendering differences in fonts or spacing. If the tool reports high difference percentages for supposedly similar documents, check that you're comparing the right versions—completely different files will show near 100% difference. Use this tool to verify changes rather than identify what specifically changed; for detailed text diffs, consider converting to Word and using track changes.

pdf-page-numbers.p2: Select where you want page numbers to appear (top or bottom, left, center, or right) and configure the starting number and format style. The tool adds numbers to all pages consistently, using a font size and style that complements your document. You can exclude the first page if it's a cover sheet or begin numbering from a specific page in the middle of the document. All page numbering happens in your browser, keeping documents containing proprietary information or confidential content private on your device during the numbering process.
pdf-page-numbers.p3: Students add page numbers to thesis drafts to meet university formatting requirements before final submission. Lawyers number exhibit pages in case filings to comply with court document formatting rules. Technical writers add page numbers to user manuals so support teams can reference specific pages during customer troubleshooting calls. Event planners number conference program PDFs to help attendees navigate session schedules and venue maps. HR departments add page numbers to employee handbooks to facilitate easier reference during policy discussions and training sessions.
pdf-page-numbers.p4: Check existing page numbers before adding new ones to avoid creating duplicates if some pages already have numbering. For documents that will be printed and bound, position numbers with sufficient margin clearance to prevent trimming during the binding process. If your document has distinct sections requiring different numbering styles (like Roman numerals for front matter), consider splitting the PDF, numbering sections separately, then merging them back together. Choose font sizes large enough to be legible but not so prominent that they distract from page content. Preview several pages across the document before finalizing to ensure consistent placement, especially if pages have varying content layouts.

pdf-watermark.p2: Type your watermark text and adjust font size, opacity, rotation angle, and positioning to create either subtle branding or prominent copyright protection. The watermark applies to all pages simultaneously with consistent placement and styling. You can make watermarks nearly transparent for background branding or highly opaque to prevent unauthorized use of documents. All watermarking happens locally in your browser, keeping proprietary presentations and confidential reports private on your device while adding protection layers.
pdf-watermark.p3: Photographers watermark portfolio PDFs with copyright notices before sending work samples to potential clients to discourage unauthorized use. Consultants add "Confidential Draft" watermarks to proposal versions shared during client review to prevent premature external distribution. Real estate agencies watermark property listing PDFs with agency branding to maintain attribution when agents share materials with buyers. Academic researchers watermark preprint PDFs with "Not for Distribution" labels before circulating to peer reviewers. Law firms watermark discovery document PDFs with case numbers and confidentiality designations for organized case management.
pdf-watermark.p4: Set watermark opacity between 20-40% for subtle background branding that doesn't interfere with document readability, or use 80-100% for prominent protection on sensitive materials. Diagonal watermarks across page centers are harder to crop out than those placed in corners. Test watermark visibility on both screen and printed versions since opacity appears differently in each medium. For copyright protection, include the copyright symbol, year, and rights holder name rather than just generic "Confidential" text. Avoid placing watermarks over critical content areas like charts, tables, or signature lines where they might obscure important information.

pdf-ocr.p2: Upload scanned PDFs or image-based documents and the tool applies optical character recognition to detect and extract text from the visual content. Tesseract.js technology analyzes each page, identifies text regions, recognizes individual characters, and converts the image into searchable, copyable text. You can select from eight supported languages to improve recognition accuracy for non-English documents. All OCR processing runs entirely in your browser using client-side machine learning models, ensuring scanned contracts, receipts, and personal documents never upload to external servers.
pdf-ocr.p3: Accountants extract text from scanned invoice images to copy vendor information and amounts into bookkeeping software without manual retyping. Researchers convert scanned pages from old library books into searchable text for quoting in academic papers. Legal assistants extract text from court filing image PDFs to search for specific case references and dates. Students convert photographed lecture notes into typed text for organizing digital study guides. Genealogists extract names and dates from scanned historical document images for family tree databases.
pdf-ocr.p4: OCR accuracy improves significantly with high-contrast scans—ensure original documents are clearly legible before scanning for best text recognition results. Select the correct language setting to match your document's content, as character recognition algorithms are trained on specific language patterns. Clean scans with minimal skew and distortion work better than photos taken at angles or with shadows. Always proofread OCR output carefully, especially for numbers, dates, and proper nouns where recognition errors are common. For multi-page documents, process a single test page first to verify language settings and quality before committing to processing the entire file.

pdf-repair.p2: Upload corrupted PDFs that won't open in standard readers and the tool attempts two-stage recovery using pdf-lib and pdfjs-dist libraries. First, it tries to reconstruct the document structure and fix header corruption. If that fails, it attempts deeper recovery by extracting intact page content and rebuilding the file from recoverable elements. The success rate depends on the type and extent of corruption—complete recovery isn't always possible for severely damaged files. All repair attempts process locally in your browser, keeping potentially corrupted documents containing sensitive information private on your device.
pdf-repair.p3: IT professionals recover project documentation PDFs corrupted during failed disk recovery operations. Students repair thesis drafts damaged when systems crashed during saving. Archivists attempt to recover historical PDF documents degraded by bit rot on aging storage media. Legal teams recover corrupted case file PDFs before critical filing deadlines when backups aren't available. Finance departments repair damaged invoice PDFs received from vendors with transmission errors or storage issues.
pdf-repair.p4: Always keep original corrupted files until you verify repaired versions are complete and usable—the repair process might recover partial content but lose some pages or formatting. If initial repair fails, try converting the corrupted PDF to images first using a different tool, which might preserve visual content even if structural repair isn't possible. For important documents, consider professional data recovery services if automated repair fails, especially for legal records or irreplaceable archives. Regular backups prevent corruption disasters—this tool should be a last resort rather than a substitute for proper file management. Check that all pages, images, and formatting survived the repair process before discarding the corrupted original.

pdf-to-pdfa.p2: Upload any standard PDF and the tool converts it to PDF/A-1b format, an ISO-standardized archival variant designed for long-term preservation. The conversion embeds all fonts, images, and content directly into the file, removes external dependencies, and adds conformance metadata that archival systems recognize. PDF/A files are self-contained and don't rely on external resources that might become unavailable over time. All conversion happens in your browser, keeping archival documents containing historical records or proprietary information private on your device during the standardization process.
pdf-to-pdfa.p3: Corporate archivists convert business records to PDF/A format to comply with document retention regulations requiring specific preservation standards. Legal departments convert executed contracts to PDF/A for long-term storage in compliance with statute-of-limitations requirements. Government agencies convert public records to PDF/A before submitting to national archives for permanent preservation. Healthcare organizations convert patient medical records to PDF/A to meet HIPAA-compliant archival storage standards. University libraries convert digitized rare manuscripts to PDF/A format to ensure accessibility decades into the future as technology evolves.
pdf-to-pdfa.p4: PDF/A files are larger than standard PDFs because all fonts and resources are embedded—expect size increases of 10-30% depending on original file complexity. Some advanced PDF features like JavaScript, encryption, and multimedia don't transfer to PDF/A since they're not allowed in the archival standard. Verify converted files meet your organization's specific PDF/A compliance requirements, as variations like PDF/A-2 and PDF/A-3 have different feature sets. Use PDF/A for final archival versions rather than working documents, since the format prioritizes preservation over editability. Test that archived files open correctly in PDF/A validators to confirm conformance before committing to long-term storage.

pdf-to-text.p2: Upload a PDF and the tool extracts all text content from every page, preserving paragraph breaks but removing formatting like bold, italics, and fonts. The resulting plain text can be copied directly to your clipboard or downloaded as a TXT file for use in word processors, databases, or note-taking applications. This works best with text-based PDFs rather than scanned images, which require OCR processing first. All text extraction happens in your browser, ensuring documents containing confidential information remain private on your device during the conversion process.
pdf-to-text.p3: Content writers extract text from PDF research materials to create quote compilations and reference notes for article drafting. Data analysts extract tables and figures from PDF reports to reformat into CSV files for database import. Students copy PDF lecture notes into study guide documents where they can add highlights and annotations. Translators extract source text from PDF documents to paste into translation software for language conversion. Developers extract configuration data or code snippets embedded in PDF technical documentation for copying into development environments.
pdf-to-text.p4: Extracted text loses all original formatting including headings, lists, tables, and columns—what you get is a linear text stream requiring reformatting for most uses. For PDFs with complex multi-column layouts, extracted text may appear scrambled since the tool reads left-to-right without understanding column structure. Check that special characters, symbols, and non-English text transferred correctly, as some fonts may not extract properly. If you need to preserve formatting, consider PDF-to-Word conversion instead of plain text extraction. Use this tool when you only care about content, not presentation—it's ideal for feeding text into analysis tools or creating searchable archives.

pdf-metadata.p2: Upload a PDF to view embedded metadata including document title, author name, subject description, keyword tags, creation date, modification date, page count, and file size. This information is stored in the PDF header and provides context about document origin, versioning, and content. Metadata viewing is read-only—this tool displays information without modifying the file. All metadata reading happens locally in your browser, so PDFs containing proprietary information remain on your device while you inspect their properties.
pdf-metadata.p3: Digital forensics investigators examine PDF metadata to determine when documents were created and modified during litigation discovery. Archivists check creation dates on historical document scans to organize chronological digital collections. Publishers verify author attribution and copyright dates in submitted manuscript PDFs before publication. IT security teams inspect metadata to detect potentially forged documents with suspicious creation dates or missing author information. Researchers track version history by comparing modification dates across multiple PDF drafts during collaborative writing projects.
pdf-metadata.p4: Metadata can be incomplete or inaccurate if files were created by converters that don't populate fields properly—absence of metadata doesn't necessarily indicate tampering. Author names often reflect the computer account or PDF software license rather than the actual document creator. Creation and modification dates can be manipulated or reset during file conversion, so don't rely solely on timestamps for authentication. Some PDF generators strip metadata entirely for privacy reasons, resulting in blank or minimal information fields. If you need to edit or remove metadata for privacy before sharing files, use a dedicated metadata removal tool rather than manual editing.

grayscale-pdf.p2: Upload a color PDF and the tool converts all page content to grayscale by removing color information from images, graphics, and text. The conversion preserves document layout, fonts, and structure while transforming the color space from RGB/CMYK to grayscale values. This reduces file size and prepares documents for black-and-white printing where color would waste toner. All grayscale conversion happens locally in your browser, keeping documents containing confidential information or proprietary designs private on your device during color removal.
grayscale-pdf.p3: Students convert color textbook PDFs to grayscale before printing to avoid expensive color printing fees at campus print centers. Small businesses convert marketing materials to black-and-white for cost-effective mass printing of internal training guides. Archivists convert historical document scans to grayscale when color provides no additional informational value. Researchers prepare journal article manuscript PDFs in grayscale to comply with publisher submission requirements. Environmental groups convert color documents to grayscale to reduce printer toner consumption and extend cartridge life.
grayscale-pdf.p4: Test critical diagrams and charts after conversion to ensure important distinctions originally shown in color remain clear in grayscale—some color-coded information may become ambiguous. Grayscale conversion typically reduces file size by 30-50% for image-heavy documents since grayscale data requires less storage than full color. If your PDF contains critical color-coded content like maps or data visualizations, consider whether grayscale conversion will make the document less useful. The tool doesn't enhance contrast or adjust brightness—if scanned originals are faded, convert to grayscale first won't improve legibility. For professional printing, check whether your print service actually requires grayscale PDFs or can accept color files and handle conversion themselves.

redact-pdf.p2: Enter keywords or phrases to search throughout your PDF, then the tool highlights all matches for review before permanently blacking them out. You can redact sensitive information like social security numbers, names, account numbers, or confidential data by converting text into solid black rectangles. The redaction is permanent—text under black boxes is completely removed from the file rather than simply covered. All redaction happens locally in your browser using client-side processing, ensuring documents containing sensitive personal or business information never upload to external servers.
redact-pdf.p3: Legal teams redact confidential settlement amounts and trade secrets from court filings before submitting to public dockets. HR departments redact employee social security numbers and salary information from internal documents before sharing with external auditors. Healthcare providers redact patient names and medical record numbers from case studies before publishing for educational purposes. Government agencies redact classified information and personally identifiable details from Freedom of Information Act request responses. Financial institutions redact account numbers and personal details from transaction records before sharing with compliance investigators.
redact-pdf.p4: Always review search results carefully before applying redactions, as keyword matching may catch false positives that shouldn't be redacted. Redact more context than strictly necessary if removing isolated words might leave enough clues to deduce sensitive information from surrounding text. Test redacted PDFs by attempting to select or search under black boxes to verify text was truly removed rather than just covered. For systematic redaction of consistent patterns like social security numbers, use regex-style searches if available rather than redacting individual occurrences manually. Keep an unredacted master copy in secure storage before distributing redacted versions, as the redaction process is irreversible once the file is saved.

extract-pdf-images.p2: PDF를 업로드하면 도구가 각 페이지를 개별적으로 다운로드하거나 전체 ZIP 아카이브로 다운로드할 수 있는 고해상도 PNG 이미지 파일로 변환합니다. 각 페이지는 프레젠테이션, 웹 게시 또는 이미지 편집에 적합한 인쇄 품질 해상도로 렌더링됩니다. 이것은 포함된 이미지를 추출하는 것과 다릅니다. 대신 텍스트, 그래픽 및 서식을 포함한 전체 페이지 레이아웃을 완전한 시각적 스냅샷으로 캡처합니다. 모든 이미지 추출은 브라우저에서 수행되어 독점 디자인이나 기밀 콘텐츠가 포함된 문서를 변환 프로세스 중에 기기에서 비공개로 유지합니다.
extract-pdf-images.p3: 디자이너는 클라이언트 작업을 보여주는 포트폴리오 웹사이트에 삽입하기 위해 프레젠테이션 슬라이드를 이미지로 추출합니다. 소셜 미디어 관리자는 인포그래픽 페이지를 Instagram 및 LinkedIn용 공유 가능한 이미지 게시물로 변환합니다. 교사는 직접 PDF 포함을 지원하지 않는 학습 관리 시스템에 업로드하기 위해 워크시트 페이지를 이미지로 추출합니다. 이벤트 주최자는 PDF 뷰어를 사용할 수 없는 모바일 앱 통합을 위해 일정 페이지를 이미지로 변환합니다. 블로거는 튜토리얼 기사에 삽화로 포함하기 위해 기술 PDF에서 다이어그램 페이지를 추출합니다.
extract-pdf-images.p4: PNG 형식은 파일 크기가 더 크지만 JPG보다 텍스트 명확성과 선명한 가장자리를 더 잘 보존합니다. 텍스트가 많은 페이지에는 PNG를, 사진이 많은 콘텐츠에는 JPG를 사용하세요. 이 도구는 기본적으로 화면 해상도로 페이지를 렌더링합니다. 인쇄 용도나 대형 디스플레이의 경우 더 높은 DPI 내보내기 옵션을 사용할 수 있는지 확인하세요. 큰 문서의 모든 페이지를 추출하면 많은 파일이 생성됩니다. 전체 문서 대신 특정 페이지만 필요한 경우 선택적 추출을 사용하세요. 추출된 이미지는 정적 스냅샷이므로 하이퍼링크 및 대화형 PDF 기능이 이미지 버전에서 작동하지 않습니다. 추출된 콘텐츠를 편집해야 하는 경우 PNG 파일에서 직접 텍스트를 수정하는 대신 전용 이미지 편집 소프트웨어를 사용하는 것을 고려하세요.

image-converter.p2: 이미지 파일을 업로드하고 원하는 출력 형식(JPG, PNG, WebP, GIF 또는 BMP)을 선택합니다. 도구는 이미지를 새 형식으로 변환하여 가능한 경우 품질과 메타데이터를 보존합니다. 출력 형식에 따라 압축 수준이나 투명도 처리와 같은 형식별 옵션을 조정할 수 있습니다. 모든 변환은 브라우저에서 로컬로 발생하여 이미지 개인정보 보호를 보장합니다.
image-converter.p3: 웹 개발자들은 더 빠른 로딩 시간을 위해 이미지를 WebP로 변환합니다. 그래픽 디자이너들은 다양한 클라이언트 요구 사항에 맞게 형식 간에 변환합니다. 사진가들은 범용 공유를 위해 RAW 이미지를 JPG로 변환합니다. 소셜 미디어 관리자들은 플랫폼 요구 사항에 맞게 이미지를 최적화합니다. 이커머스 관리자들은 일관된 형식을 위해 제품 이미지를 변환합니다.
image-converter.p4: 투명도가 필요한 경우 PNG나 WebP를 선택하세요. JPG는 투명도를 지원하지 않습니다. 사진의 경우 JPG나 WebP가 파일 크기가 작은 좋은 압축을 제공합니다. 선명한 가장자리가 있는 그래픽이나 스크린샷의 경우 PNG가 더 나은 결과를 제공합니다. WebP는 우수한 압축과 품질을 제공하지만 이전 브라우저는 지원하지 않을 수 있습니다. 변환 후 이미지를 확인하여 품질이 용도에 맞는지 확인하세요. 특히 압축 손실 형식으로 변환할 때 더욱 그렇습니다.

image-editor.p2: Upload an image to access crop, resize, rotate, flip, brightness/contrast/saturation adjustments, and compression controls all in a unified interface. Make multiple edits in sequence without downloading and reuploading between operations—adjust brightness, then crop, then resize in one continuous workflow. The visual preview updates in real-time as you modify settings, letting you fine-tune adjustments before applying final changes. All editing happens locally in your browser using Canvas API, so personal photos, business graphics, or proprietary design files remain private on your device throughout the editing process.
image-editor.p3: Social media managers crop product photos to square aspect ratios for Instagram while adjusting brightness for optimal mobile display. Real estate agents rotate sideways property photos and enhance contrast to make room details more visible in listings. Bloggers resize header images to exact pixel dimensions required by website templates while compressing file size for faster loading. E-commerce sellers adjust saturation and lighting on product shots to ensure accurate color representation. Event photographers batch-edit brightness and crop ratios on hundreds of event photos before client delivery.
image-editor.p4: Make destructive edits like cropping and rotation first before adjusting colors, since those operations change the pixel data that color adjustments will affect. When resizing, maintain aspect ratio unless you specifically need a different shape—arbitrary resizing can distort subjects. Use incremental adjustments for brightness and saturation rather than extreme shifts, as over-processing creates unnatural appearance and posterization artifacts. Compress as the final step after all other edits are complete to avoid repeatedly compressing the same data and accumulating quality loss. Save originals separately before editing important images, since edits are permanent once you download the result.

image-compressor.p2: 이미지 파일을 업로드하고 원하는 압축 수준을 선택합니다. 도구는 이미지 크기를 줄이는 고급 압축 알고리즘을 적용하면서 허용 가능한 시각적 품질을 유지합니다. 파일 크기 감소와 이미지 품질 간의 균형을 제어하는 압축 슬라이더를 조정할 수 있습니다. 실시간 미리보기를 통해 압축하기 전에 결과를 볼 수 있습니다. 모든 처리는 브라우저에서 로컬로 발생합니다.
image-compressor.p3: 웹 개발자들은 페이지 로드 시간을 개선하기 위해 웹사이트 이미지를 압축합니다. 블로거들은 대역폭 사용량을 줄이기 위해 게시물 이미지를 최적화합니다. 소셜 미디어 관리자들은 업로드 제한에 맞게 이미지 크기를 줄입니다. 이커머스 관리자들은 빠른 제품 페이지 로딩을 위해 제품 사진을 압축합니다. 이메일 마케터들은 첨부 파일 크기 제한 내에서 유지하기 위해 뉴스레터 이미지를 최적화합니다.
image-compressor.p4: 최상의 결과를 위해 웹 사용이나 소셜 미디어와 같이 파일 크기가 중요한 이미지를 압축하세요. 인쇄나 전문 사진의 경우 원본 고품질 파일을 보관하고 웹 배포용으로만 압축하세요. 압축 후 다양한 장치와 화면 크기에서 이미지를 테스트하여 품질이 허용 가능한지 확인하세요. 이미지를 여러 번 압축하지 마세요. 품질 저하가 누적됩니다. 압축 설정이 다른 여러 버전을 만들어 프로젝트에 가장 적합한 균형을 찾으세요.

image-resizer.p2: 이미지를 업로드하고 새로운 크기를 픽셀, 백분율 또는 일반적인 사전 설정으로 지정합니다. 도구는 이미지 크기를 조정하는 동안 고품질 리샘플링 알고리즘을 사용하여 선명도를 유지합니다. 가로 세로 비율을 잠그거나 특정 크기에 맞게 이미지를 자르도록 선택할 수 있습니다. 실시간 미리보기를 통해 크기 조정 전에 결과를 볼 수 있습니다. 모든 처리는 브라우저에서 로컬로 발생합니다.
image-resizer.p3: 웹 개발자들은 반응형 웹 디자인을 위해 이미지 크기를 조정합니다. 그래픽 디자이너들은 다양한 플랫폼 요구 사항에 맞게 이미지를 준비합니다. 소셜 미디어 관리자들은 최적의 표시를 위해 게시물 크기를 조정합니다. 이커머스 관리자들은 일관된 제품 목록을 위해 제품 이미지를 표준화합니다. 사진가들은 웹 갤러리나 클라이언트 미리보기를 위해 사진 크기를 줄입니다.
image-resizer.p4: 크기를 늘릴 때는 픽셀화를 방지하기 위해 고품질 소스 이미지로 시작하세요. 크기를 줄일 때는 선명도를 유지하기 위해 샤프닝 필터를 적용하는 것을 고려하세요. 가로 세로 비율을 유지하여 왜곡을 방지하세요. 특정 크기가 필요한 경우에만 자르기를 사용하세요. 크기 조정 후 이미지를 확인하여 품질이 용도에 맞는지 확인하세요. 특히 크기를 크게 변경할 때 더욱 그렇습니다. 웹 사용의 경우 크기를 조정한 후 압축하여 파일 크기를 더 줄이세요.

image-cropper.p2: 이미지를 업로드하고 자르기 도구를 사용하여 유지하려는 영역을 선택합니다. 자유형 선택을 그리거나 일반적인 가로 세로 비율(정사각형, 16:9, 4:3 등)에 맞는 사전 설정 비율을 사용할 수 있습니다. 실시간 미리보기를 통해 최종 결과를 보기 전에 정확하게 위치를 지정할 수 있습니다. 자르기가 완료되면 선택한 영역만 포함하는 새 이미지를 다운로드합니다. 모든 처리는 브라우저에서 로컬로 발생합니다.
image-cropper.p3: 사진가들은 구도를 개선하기 위해 사진을 자릅니다. 소셜 미디어 관리자들은 플랫폼 요구 사항에 맞게 이미지를 자릅니다. 그래픽 디자이너들은 레이아웃에 맞게 디자인 요소를 추출합니다. 이커머스 관리자들은 제품에 초점을 맞추기 위해 제품 사진을 자릅니다. 블로거들은 추천 이미지와 썸네일을 준비하기 위해 이미지를 자릅니다.
image-cropper.p4: 중요한 콘텐츠를 자르지 않도록 주의하세요. 특히 텍스트나 얼굴이 있는 이미지의 경우 더욱 그렇습니다. 소셜 미디어나 웹사이트의 경우 플랫폼 권장 사항에 맞게 사전 설정 가로 세로 비율을 사용하세요. 자르기 전에 최종 사용 크기를 고려하세요. 너무 가깝게 자르면 나중에 크기를 조정할 때 픽셀화될 수 있습니다. 자른 후 이미지가 여전히 높은 시각적 품질을 유지하고 의도한 메시지를 전달하는지 확인하세요. 필요한 경우 원본 파일의 백업 사본을 보관하세요.

image-to-text.p2: Upload a screenshot, scanned document, or photo containing text and select the appropriate language from the six supported options. Tuttilo's OCR engine runs Tesseract.js locally in your browser, analyzing character shapes and patterns to extract readable text. The process takes a few seconds depending on image size and complexity. Once complete, copy the extracted text to your clipboard or edit it directly in the output box. No image data is sent to external servers during recognition.
image-to-text.p3: Students digitize handwritten notes or textbook pages to create searchable study documents. Researchers extract data from old paper archives or scientific charts that exist only in scanned form. Translators copy foreign-language text from images into translation software when manual retyping would be time-consuming. Business professionals pull contact details from business cards captured by phone cameras. Developers extract code snippets from programming tutorial screenshots when copy-paste isn't available.
image-to-text.p4: Use high-contrast images with dark text on light backgrounds for best accuracy, ideally scanned at 300 DPI or higher. Rotate or straighten skewed photos before processing, since tilted text reduces recognition rates significantly. Clean up noise, stains, or shadows in image editing software if the original is poor quality. For handwritten text, printed fonts perform far better than cursive scripts. Break large documents into smaller sections to speed up processing and isolate errors. Double-check numbers, special characters, and technical terms manually, as OCR struggles with unusual glyphs.

meme-maker.p2: Upload any image and type your text into the top and bottom caption fields. The classic white Impact font with black stroke appears automatically, mimicking the traditional meme format used across the internet since 2007. Adjust font size with the slider to fit longer or shorter phrases. Change text color if you want to break from convention or match a specific aesthetic. The tool renders captions directly onto your image using browser canvas, then lets you download the finished meme as a PNG without watermarks or branding.
meme-maker.p3: Social media users create reaction memes from trending templates like "Distracted Boyfriend" or "Drake Hotline Bling" to comment on current events. Content creators add humorous captions to original photos from their lives, turning personal moments into shareable jokes. Marketing teams develop branded memes that reference industry inside jokes while promoting products in a casual tone. Community managers respond to user feedback with meme formats to humanize customer support interactions. Educators use memes to make lesson content relatable and memorable for students familiar with internet culture.
meme-maker.p4: Keep top text as the setup and bottom text as the punchline for traditional meme structure. Use ALL CAPS for maximum impact, but avoid walls of text that require tiny font sizes to fit. Choose images with clear focal subjects and minimal background clutter so text remains readable. For viral potential, reference current events or trending topics within 48 hours while they're still relevant. Test different text colors against busy backgrounds to maintain contrast and legibility. Save your meme in PNG format to preserve text sharpness when shared across platforms.

add-text-to-image.p2: 기본 이미지를 업로드한 후 클릭하여 첫 번째 텍스트 레이어를 추가합니다. 메시지를 입력하고 드롭다운에서 글꼴을 선택한 다음 색상 피커로 색상을 고르고 슬라이더로 크기를 조정합니다. 캔버스 위 어디든 드래그하여 텍스트 위치를 조정할 수 있습니다. 추가 버튼을 다시 클릭하면 다른 스타일, 크기, 위치의 여러 텍스트 요소를 쌓아올릴 수 있습니다. 각 레이어는 독립적으로 편집하거나 삭제할 수 있습니다. 만족스러우면 모든 텍스트가 원본 사진에 영구적으로 렌더링된 합성 이미지를 PNG로 다운로드합니다.
add-text-to-image.p3: 이벤트 주최자는 날짜, 시간, 장소 정보를 홍보 사진 위에 오버레이하여 전단지와 소셜 미디어 그래픽을 만듭니다. 교육자는 다이어그램이나 역사 사진에 레이블, 화살표, 설명 노트를 주석으로 달아 교실 프레젠테이션에 활용합니다. 부동산 중개인은 매물 사진에 직접 부동산 세부 정보, 가격, 연락처 정보를 추가합니다. 명언 제작자는 풍경 배경 위에 영감을 주는 텍스트를 겹쳐 Pinterest와 Instagram 게시물을 만듭니다. 제품 디자이너는 개발자에게 전달하기 전에 앱 스크린샷에 UI 텍스트를 목업으로 배치합니다.
add-text-to-image.p4: 텍스트 요소를 중요도 순서대로 레이어링하세요. 큰 헤드라인을 먼저, 보조 세부 사항을 두 번째로, 작은 글씨를 마지막에 배치합니다. 대비되는 글꼴 두께와 크기를 사용하여 시각적 위계를 구축하고 보는 이의 시선을 안내하세요. 복잡한 배경 위에 배치된 텍스트에는 미묘한 그림자나 외곽선을 추가하여 가독성 문제를 방지합니다. 어수선하고 아마추어 같은 느낌을 피하려면 최대 2~3개의 조화로운 글꼴만 사용하세요. 텍스트를 보이지 않는 그리드 라인이나 이미지 요소에 정렬하여 세련되고 전문적인 구성을 만듭니다. 레티나 디스플레이에서 볼 때나 인쇄할 경우 2배 해상도로 내보내세요.

compress-video.p2: 기기에서 비디오 파일을 로드하고 슬라이더를 사용하여 대상 품질 수준을 선택합니다. 작은 파일 크기를 위한 공격적인 압축에서 거의 원본 품질에 가까운 최소 압축까지 다양합니다. 이 도구는 MediaRecorder API와 함께 H.264 코덱을 사용하여 비디오를 다시 인코딩하여 시각적 충실도와 파일 크기의 균형을 맞춥니다. 전체 파일을 처리하기 전에 압축을 평가하기 위해 짧은 샘플을 미리 봅니다. 인코더는 전적으로 브라우저에서 실행되므로 하드웨어에 따라 큰 비디오가 몇 분 걸릴 수 있습니다. 인코딩이 완료되면 압축된 결과를 다운로드합니다.
compress-video.p3: 비디오 편집자는 YouTube 또는 클라이언트 검토 플랫폼에 더 빠르게 업로드하기 위해 4K 영상을 1080p로 축소합니다. 모바일 사용자는 셀룰러 데이터 제한을 피하기 위해 문자 메시지나 이메일로 보내기 전에 휴대폰으로 녹화한 클립을 압축합니다. 팟캐스터는 페이지 로드 시간을 늦추지 않고 웹사이트에 포함하기 위해 비디오 파일 크기를 줄입니다. 아카이브 관리자는 시청 가능한 품질을 유지하면서 하드 드라이브 공간을 절약하기 위해 오래된 홈 비디오를 일괄 압축합니다. 코스 제작자는 학습 관리 시스템 파일 크기 제한에 맞게 튜토리얼 비디오를 최적화합니다.
compress-video.p4: 동일한 10초 클립에서 다양한 품질 설정을 테스트하여 크기 축소와 허용 가능한 시각적 손실 사이의 최적 지점을 찾으세요. 이미 압축된 비디오를 반복적으로 압축하지 마세요. 각 세대는 누적 아티팩트를 통해 품질을 저하시킵니다. 토킹 헤드 비디오의 경우 시청자가 낮은 해상도는 견딜 수 있지만 왜곡된 음성은 견딜 수 없으므로 비디오보다 오디오 비트레이트를 우선시하세요. 허용 가능한 최고 품질로 한 번 압축한 다음 향후 편집을 위해 원본 압축되지 않은 파일을 별도로 저장하세요. 임시 공유 링크에는 공격적인 압축을 사용하되 보관 또는 전문 용도로는 보통 설정을 유지하세요.

trim-video.p2: Upload your video and drag the left handle to set the starting point, then drag the right handle to mark the ending point. The visual timeline displays thumbnails so you can pinpoint exact frames without guessing. Click the play button to preview only the selected portion before committing. Adjust handles as needed for precise trimming down to the second. The tool extracts the chosen segment using browser-based media processing, leaving the original untouched. Download the trimmed clip when satisfied with the selection.
trim-video.p3: Content creators cut raw footage to remove long intros, outros, or mistakes before uploading to TikTok or YouTube Shorts. Parents trim lengthy kid videos down to the highlight moments worth sharing with family. Journalists extract specific sound bites or clips from longer interview recordings for news packages. Tutorial makers cut out pauses, restarts, or off-topic tangents to maintain pacing in instructional videos. Event videographers isolate specific speeches or performances from multi-hour ceremony recordings.
trim-video.p4: Leave a half-second buffer on each end of your desired clip to avoid cutting off the first or last word. Use the play preview repeatedly to confirm the trim points feel natural and don't interrupt mid-action. For social media, trim to under 60 seconds to maximize platform compatibility and viewer retention. When trimming out sensitive content, verify the excluded portion doesn't appear in thumbnail previews. Export the trimmed clip at the same resolution and frame rate as the original to avoid unnecessary re-encoding.

video-to-gif.p2: Upload a video file and use the trim handles to select the segment you want to convert, typically 2-6 seconds for optimal GIF file size. Adjust the frames per second slider to control smoothness versus file size: higher FPS creates fluid motion but larger files. Set the output width in pixels, and the height scales proportionally. Click convert and the tool extracts frames from your video, quantizes colors using a 256-color palette, and encodes the animated GIF using the gifenc library entirely in your browser. Download the finished GIF when processing completes.
video-to-gif.p3: Social media users convert funny video moments into looping GIFs for sharing in chats, Reddit threads, or Twitter replies where video autoplay is disabled. Designers create animated product demos or UI interactions to embed in email campaigns or landing pages. Gamers capture epic moments from gameplay recordings to share as reaction GIFs in Discord servers. Tutorial creators illustrate short how-to steps with looping GIF sequences that viewers can watch repeatedly without video controls. Meme makers transform viral video clips into portable GIF format for easier embedding across platforms.
video-to-gif.p4: Keep GIF duration under 5 seconds to avoid massive file sizes that fail to upload on most platforms, which cap GIFs at 15-20 MB. Reduce output width to 480-600 pixels for social media, since GIFs above 1080p become impractically large. Lower FPS to 10-15 for simple motion like text or slow movements, but use 20-24 FPS for fast action to prevent choppy playback. Trim out static frames at the beginning or end to save space and create a perfect loop. Export from the highest quality video source available, as GIFs inherit compression artifacts from their source material.

video-to-mp3.p2: Select a video file containing the audio you want to extract. The tool loads the video in your browser and separates the audio track from the visual component using media stream APIs. Processing happens locally without uploading to any server. Once extraction completes, download the audio as an MP3 file, preserving the original bitrate and sample rate when possible. The video file remains unchanged on your device. Extraction time depends on video length and your computer's processing power.
video-to-mp3.p3: Music fans extract audio from music video downloads to build MP3 libraries for offline listening in car stereos or music players. Podcast listeners convert video podcast episodes to audio-only MP3s for smaller file sizes and compatibility with audio-focused apps. Language learners isolate dialogue tracks from foreign films to create listening comprehension practice files. DJs rip audio from performance videos to remix or sample in production software. Researchers convert lecture or interview videos to audio for easier note-taking and transcription.
video-to-mp3.p4: Verify the video has an actual audio track before processing; screen recordings or silent clips will produce empty MP3 files. Higher bitrate source videos yield better MP3 quality, so extract from 1080p or higher when possible. For music extraction, avoid videos with introductions or outros unless you trim the video first. Use dedicated audio compression tools after extraction if the MP3 file is too large for your needs. Check the sample rate and bitrate of the extracted MP3 if you plan to edit or mix it with other audio files.

video-converter.p2: Upload a video in any supported format, then select your desired output format from the dropdown menu. Common choices include MP4 for universal compatibility, WebM for web embedding, or AVI for editing software. Click convert and the tool re-encodes your video using browser-based processing powered by MediaRecorder API. Conversion time scales with video length and resolution; a 5-minute 1080p clip may take several minutes. Download the converted file when encoding finishes, with your original file remaining intact on your device.
video-converter.p3: Video editors convert raw footage from cameras that record in proprietary formats into standard MP4 for compatibility with editing software. Web developers convert MP4 videos to WebM for smaller file sizes and better HTML5 video performance. Mobile users convert old AVI or MKV files to MP4 for playback on smartphones and tablets that don't support legacy codecs. Content archivists standardize mixed-format video libraries into a single consistent format for long-term storage. Cross-platform teams convert between formats to ensure videos play on both Mac and Windows machines.
video-converter.p4: Convert to MP4 with H.264 codec for maximum compatibility across devices, browsers, and media players. Choose WebM for web use when file size matters more than broad legacy device support. Avoid converting between lossy formats repeatedly, as each conversion degrades quality through re-compression. Keep frame rate and resolution the same as the source unless you specifically need to downscale. Test the converted file on the target device or platform before deleting the original, since codec quirks can cause unexpected playback issues.

rotate-video.p2: Upload a video that was recorded in the wrong orientation, common when filming on smartphones without rotation lock. Select the rotation angle: 90° clockwise, 90° counterclockwise, or 180° for upside-down videos. Click rotate and the tool processes the video in your browser, transposing pixel coordinates and adjusting metadata to reflect the new orientation. The output maintains the original video quality without re-encoding compression. Download the corrected video, now oriented properly for normal playback on any device.
rotate-video.p3: Smartphone users fix vertical videos accidentally recorded in landscape mode or horizontal clips shot upside-down. Content creators correct footage from mounted cameras that were installed at the wrong angle. Video archivists rotate old VHS transfers that were digitized in incorrect orientation. Social media managers adjust videos to match platform requirements, rotating landscape videos to portrait for Instagram Stories. Drone pilots correct footage from cameras that tilted during flight or were mounted incorrectly before takeoff.
rotate-video.p4: Check the original video metadata before rotating, as some players automatically rotate based on embedded orientation flags. Rotate only once to avoid cumulative quality loss from multiple re-encoding passes. For mobile videos, rotate to match the intended viewing orientation rather than the recording orientation. Verify the rotated video's width and height match your expectations, especially if rotating between landscape and portrait. Save the original file if you're unsure about the correct rotation, since reversing the process requires another re-encode.

mute-video.p2: Upload a video file containing audio you want to remove. The tool extracts the video stream while discarding the audio track entirely, creating a silent version using browser-based processing. No re-encoding of the visual component occurs, so video quality remains identical to the source. Processing completes in seconds for most files. Download the muted video, which plays silently across all media players and platforms. The original file stays on your device unchanged.
mute-video.p3: Social media users mute videos with copyrighted music before uploading to platforms that flag audio copyright violations. Privacy-conscious creators remove background conversations or identifying audio from footage before sharing publicly. Screen recorders strip accidental microphone audio from tutorial videos when narration wasn't intended. Video editors create silent B-roll clips for layering custom music or voiceover in editing software. Content moderators mute inappropriate or offensive audio while preserving the visual content.
mute-video.p4: Mute the video before adding new audio in editing software to avoid mixing unwanted original sound with your soundtrack. Verify the muted video actually has no audio track by checking file properties or playing at max volume. Use this tool for removing entire audio tracks; trim or cut audio tools work better for removing specific segments. For videos with multiple audio tracks, this removes all of them rather than selectively deleting one. Export the muted file and check playback before deleting the original, as some formats may behave unexpectedly without audio metadata.

change-video-speed.p2: 비디오를 업로드하고 슬라이더에서 속도 승수를 선택합니다. 1.0 미만의 값은 비디오를 느리게 하고 1.0 이상의 값은 빠르게 합니다. 일반적인 사전 설정에는 반속도 슬로우 모션의 경우 0.5배, 보통 가속의 경우 1.5배 및 2배 속도의 경우 2.0배가 포함됩니다. 이 도구는 브라우저에서 비디오를 처리하여 프레임 타이밍과 오디오 피치를 비례적으로 조정합니다. 속도 변경이 원하는 효과를 달성하는지 확인하기 위해 세그먼트를 미리 봅니다. 처리가 완료되면 시간 조정된 비디오를 다운로드합니다.
change-video-speed.p3: 튜토리얼 시청자는 이해력을 유지하면서 콘텐츠를 더 빨리 소비하기 위해 느린 속도의 교육 비디오를 1.5배 또는 2배로 빠르게 합니다. 스포츠 분석가는 게임 플레이 영상을 0.25배로 느리게 하여 기술, 폼 또는 논란의 여지가 있는 심판 콜을 프레임별로 연구합니다. 콘텐츠 제작자는 소셜 미디어 시간 제한에 맞게 그림 그리기 또는 건설과 같은 긴 프로세스의 타임랩스 스타일 비디오를 가속화합니다. 교육자는 일반 속도에서 놓친 세부 사항을 관찰해야 하는 학생을 위해 복잡한 데모를 느리게 합니다. 비디오 블로거는 청중을 지루하게 하지 않고 페이싱을 유지하기 위해 여행 또는 루틴 시퀀스를 빠르게 합니다.
change-video-speed.p4: 높은 속도에서는 오디오가 다람쥐 피치가 되고 느린 속도에서는 깊어집니다. 효과가 허용되지 않으면 오디오를 교체할 계획을 세우세요. 이해도를 유지하기 위해 음성 콘텐츠를 2배 이하로 빠르게 하되 무음 또는 음악 전용 비디오를 더 공격적으로 가속화하세요. 특정 순간을 분석할 때만 0.5배 또는 0.25배로 느리게 하세요. 시청자는 전체 슬로우 모션 비디오를 거의 보지 않습니다. 속도 변경을 트리밍과 결합하여 긴 녹화에서 주요 순간을 분리하고 강조하세요. 플랫폼 제한 또는 프레젠테이션 시간 슬롯에 맞는지 확인하기 위해 속도 변경 후 총 비디오 지속 시간을 확인하세요.

resize-video.p2: Upload a video and enter the desired output width and height in pixels. Common targets include 1920×1080 for full HD, 1280×720 for HD, or 640×480 for smaller web embeds. Toggle aspect ratio lock to maintain proportions or unlock to stretch the video to exact dimensions. The tool re-encodes your video at the new resolution using browser-based processing. Downscaling reduces file size, while upscaling enlarges smaller videos at the cost of added blur. Download the resized video when conversion completes.
resize-video.p3: Web developers resize videos to specific dimensions required by templates or content management systems. Social media managers downscale 4K uploads to 1080p to speed up processing and save bandwidth. Mobile users resize large desktop recordings to smaller dimensions for easier sharing via messaging apps. Video editors upscale lower-resolution archival footage to match modern project standards, accepting some quality loss. Presenters resize videos to fit slide deck layouts or digital signage display resolutions.
resize-video.p4: Always downscale rather than upscale when possible, as adding pixels through interpolation introduces blur and artifacts. Maintain aspect ratio to prevent distorted, stretched video unless the target use case demands exact dimensions. Resize once to the final output size rather than multiple intermediate steps to minimize cumulative quality loss. For web use, test the resized video on mobile and desktop to confirm it displays correctly at the new dimensions. Combine resizing with compression to achieve both smaller dimensions and reduced file size in one pass.

screen-recorder.p2: Click the start button and your browser prompts you to choose what to record: entire screen, specific application window, or individual browser tab. Select your preference and optionally enable microphone audio to capture narration. The recorder captures frames in real-time using browser APIs, displaying a live timer and waveform if audio is enabled. Click stop when finished, and the tool compiles the recording into a downloadable video file. Everything processes locally without transmitting any data to external servers.
screen-recorder.p3: Software developers record bug reproductions to send to support teams, showing exact click paths and error states. Tutorial creators capture step-by-step software walkthroughs for YouTube or online course platforms. Remote workers record screen presentations when unable to attend live meetings, creating shareable async updates. Customer support agents demonstrate solutions to user questions by recording their screen while navigating the product. Educators create lecture captures by recording slides and narration simultaneously from their computer.
screen-recorder.p4: Close unnecessary browser tabs and applications before recording to prevent sensitive information from appearing in the capture. Test your microphone level with a short recording before starting a long session to avoid silent or distorted audio. Record at your display's native resolution, then downscale the video afterward if needed for smaller file sizes. Use tab recording instead of full screen when demonstrating web applications to exclude desktop notifications or distractions. Pause and resume instead of stopping and restarting to keep your recording in a single file without editing.

audio-cutter.p2: 오디오 파일을 업로드하고 시간에 따른 진폭을 나타내는 파형 시각화를 봅니다. 왼쪽 마커를 드래그하여 시작점을 설정하고 오른쪽 마커를 드래그하여 끝점을 정의하여 유지하려는 세그먼트를 격리합니다. 재생을 클릭하여 선택한 부분을 미리 듣고 소리가 올바른지 확인합니다. 파형 피크를 시각적 가이드로 사용하여 초의 분수까지 정밀하게 마커를 조정합니다. 이 도구는 브라우저 처리를 사용하여 선택한 오디오 세그먼트를 추출한 다음 잘린 파일을 다운로드할 수 있게 합니다.
audio-cutter.p3: 팟캐스터는 에피소드를 게시하기 전에 인터뷰 녹음에서 침묵, 실수 또는 긴 정지를 잘라냅니다. 음악가는 더 긴 즉흥 연주 세션 녹음에서 특정 악기 섹션이나 보컬 테이크를 추출합니다. 사운드 디자이너는 비디오 또는 게임 프로젝트에 사용하기 위해 필드 녹음에서 개별 음향 효과를 격리합니다. 언어 교사는 전체 길이 수업에서 오디오 클립을 잘라 대상 듣기 연습을 만듭니다. 콘텐츠 제작자는 특정 비디오 길이에 맞게 로열티 프리 음악 트랙에서 인트로나 아웃트로를 제거합니다.
audio-cutter.p4: 특히 단어 사이의 호흡이나 클릭을 제거할 때 정확한 절단점을 식별하기 위해 파형을 확대하세요. 단어나 음표를 갑자기 자르지 않도록 첫 번째 소리 전과 마지막 소리 후에 초의 분수를 남겨두세요. 음악의 경우 팝이나 클릭을 방지하기 위해 파형이 중심선과 교차하는 제로 크로싱 포인트에서 자르세요. 절단이 어색한 시작이나 정지 없이 자연스럽게 들리는지 확인하기 위해 재생 미리보기를 반복적으로 사용하세요. 가능하면 불필요한 재인코딩 및 품질 손실을 피하기 위해 소스 파일과 동일한 형식으로 내보내세요.

audio-converter.p2: 지원되는 형식의 오디오 파일을 업로드한 다음 드롭다운에서 원하는 출력 형식을 선택합니다. 범용 호환성을 위한 MP3, 무손실 품질을 위한 WAV, 오픈 소스 프로젝트를 위한 OGG, 보관을 위한 FLAC 또는 Apple 생태계를 위한 AAC가 있습니다. 이 도구는 브라우저에서 실행되는 Web Audio API 및 미디어 처리 라이브러리를 사용하여 소스 파일을 디코딩하고 대상 형식으로 다시 인코딩합니다. 변환 시간은 파일 길이와 선택한 형식에 따라 다릅니다. 처리가 완료되면 변환된 오디오를 다운로드합니다.
audio-converter.p3: 음악 프로듀서는 FLAC 또는 WAV 마스터를 스트리밍 플랫폼 또는 클라이언트 배달용 배포를 위해 MP3로 변환합니다. 팟캐스터는 호스팅 서비스에 업로드하기 전에 파일 크기를 줄이기 위해 녹음된 WAV 파일을 MP3로 변환합니다. 오디오 애호가는 품질 저하 없이 보관 저장을 위해 손실 MP3 파일을 무손실 FLAC로 변환합니다. 앱 개발자는 모바일 및 웹 애플리케이션과의 호환성을 위해 배경 음악을 AAC 또는 OGG 형식으로 변환합니다. 오디오 아카이브 관리자는 장기 보존을 위해 혼합 형식 컬렉션을 단일 일관된 형식으로 표준화합니다.
audio-converter.p4: 무손실에서 손실 형식으로 자유롭게 변환하되 MP3에서 AAC로와 같은 손실 형식 간 변환은 누적 압축이 품질을 저하시키므로 피하세요. 중간 편집 단계에는 WAV 또는 FLAC를 사용하고 최종 배포에만 MP3로 변환합니다. 특별히 다운샘플링이 필요한 경우가 아니면 샘플 레이트와 비트 깊이를 소스 파일과 일치시키세요. 코덱 비호환성을 감지하기 위해 원본을 삭제하기 전에 대상 애플리케이션이나 기기에서 변환된 파일을 테스트하세요. 음악의 경우 무손실 소스에 비해 거의 투명한 품질을 위해 320kbps MP3 또는 256kbps AAC로 변환하세요.

voice-recorder.p2: Click the record button and grant microphone access when your browser prompts. Speak naturally while watching the real-time waveform visualize your audio input, confirming the microphone is capturing your voice. Pause recording to collect your thoughts or skip sections, then resume without creating separate files. Click stop when finished, and the recorder compiles your audio into a downloadable file. Everything processes locally in your browser without uploading voice data to any server.
voice-recorder.p3: Students record lecture notes or study reminders verbally instead of typing, especially while commuting or multitasking. Content creators capture voice memos for podcast intros, video narration scripts, or song lyric ideas. Remote workers record voice messages for asynchronous team communication when text feels too impersonal. Language learners practice pronunciation by recording and listening back to their speech patterns. Interviewers record phone or in-person conversations with consent for transcription or reference later.
voice-recorder.p4: Position your microphone 6-12 inches from your mouth to balance volume and avoid breath noises or plosives. Record in a quiet environment and close windows, turn off fans, and silence phone notifications before starting. Use the pause button liberally to eliminate dead air, awkward silences, or interruptions. Monitor the waveform while recording; if it flatlines or clips at the top, adjust microphone level or distance. Save recordings immediately after stopping to avoid accidental data loss from browser crashes or tab closures.

audio-joiner.p2: 추가 버튼을 반복해서 클릭하거나 여러 파일을 한 번에 선택하여 여러 오디오 파일을 업로드합니다. 파일 카드를 드래그 앤 드롭하여 원하는 순서로 재정렬합니다. 이 도구는 파일을 위에서 아래 순서로 재생하여 간격이나 겹침 없이 원활하게 연결합니다. 병합된 결과를 미리 들어 배열이 올바르게 들리는지 확인합니다. 병합기는 Web Audio API를 사용하여 브라우저에서 모든 것을 처리하여 트랙을 결합합니다. 원하는 형식으로 최종 병합된 오디오 파일을 다운로드합니다.
audio-joiner.p3: 팟캐스트 편집자는 인트로 음악, 메인 에피소드 콘텐츠 및 아웃트로 음악을 게시 가능한 단일 파일로 병합합니다. 음악가는 별도의 악기 또는 보컬 녹음을 완전한 곡 배열로 결합합니다. 오디오북 제작자는 배포를 위해 개별 챕터 녹음을 전체 길이 책으로 결합합니다. 언어 코스 개발자는 어휘 레슨, 연습 및 복습 섹션을 응집력 있는 단위로 연결합니다. 사운드 디자이너는 순서대로 앰비언트 트랙, 효과 및 음악 큐를 레이어링하여 복잡한 사운드스케이프를 구축합니다.
audio-joiner.p4: 예상치 못한 피치나 속도 변경을 피하기 위해 병합하기 전에 모든 소스 파일의 샘플 레이트와 비트 깊이가 동일한지 확인하세요. 마지막 파일에 페이드아웃을 사용하고 다음 파일에 페이드인을 사용하여 서로 다른 오디오 소스 간에 부드러운 전환을 만드세요. 병합 후 시퀀스를 편집하려면 다시 업로드하고 다시 병합해야 하므로 병합하기 전에 논리적 순서로 파일을 정렬하세요. 팟캐스트의 경우 거슬리는 변화를 피하기 위해 인트로 및 아웃트로 음악을 메인 콘텐츠와 일관된 볼륨 레벨로 배치하세요. 더 편집할 계획이라면 병합된 파일을 무손실 WAV 형식으로 내보내고 최종 배포에만 MP3로 변환하세요.

change-audio-speed.p2: 오디오 파일을 업로드하고 재생 속도 승수를 선택합니다. 반속도의 경우 0.5배, 보통 가속의 경우 1.5배 또는 2배 속도의 경우 2.0배입니다. 이 도구는 브라우저에서 실행되는 시간 스트레칭 알고리즘을 사용하여 피치를 보존하려고 시도하면서 오디오 타이밍을 조정합니다. 속도 변경이 명확성과 피치에 미치는 영향을 평가하기 위해 결과를 미리 듣습니다. 느린 속도는 지속 시간을 연장하고 세부 사항을 드러낼 수 있으며 빠른 속도는 더 빠른 소비를 위해 시간을 압축합니다. 처리가 완료되면 시간 조정된 오디오를 다운로드합니다.
change-audio-speed.p3: 팟캐스트 청취자는 통근하거나 운동하는 동안 더 적은 시간에 더 많은 콘텐츠를 소비하기 위해 에피소드를 1.5배 또는 2배로 빠르게 합니다. 음악가는 복잡한 구절을 0.5배 또는 0.75배로 느리게 하여 귀로 어려운 멜로디, 솔로 또는 가사를 배웁니다. 오디오북 팬은 내레이터의 자연스러운 속도가 너무 느리게 느껴질 때 책을 더 빨리 끝내기 위해 내레이션을 가속화합니다. DJ와 프로듀서는 리믹싱을 위해 다른 BPM 목표와 일치하도록 아카펠라 또는 인스트루멘탈의 템포를 변경합니다. 필사자는 구어를 그대로 입력할 때 정확도를 향상시키기 위해 오디오를 0.75배로 느리게 합니다.
change-audio-speed.p4: 이해력을 잃지 않고 구어 콘텐츠를 1.5배 또는 2배로 빠르게 하되 아티팩트 및 왜곡을 방지하기 위해 음악은 1.25배 미만으로 유지하세요. 특정 순간을 분석할 때만 느리게 하세요. 청취자는 전체 슬로우 모션 오디오를 거의 견디지 못합니다. 속도 변경을 EQ 또는 노이즈 감소와 결합하여 더 나은 명확성을 얻으세요. 특히 아티팩트가 나타나는 극단적인 저속에서 그렇습니다. 스피커가 마스킹할 수 있는 피치 워핑이나 로봇 효과를 감지하기 위해 헤드폰으로 조정된 오디오를 테스트하세요. 추가 편집을 계획하는 경우 누적 저하를 최소화하기 위해 최고 품질 설정으로 내보내세요.

text-to-speech.p2: Type or paste text into the input field, then select a voice from your browser's built-in speech synthesis library. Adjust the speed slider to control narration pace, from slow and deliberate to fast-paced. Modify pitch if you want a higher or lower voice tone. Click play to preview the speech output, making adjustments as needed. When satisfied, click generate to process the audio, then download the file as an MP3 or WAV. The synthesis happens entirely in your browser using native Web Speech API.
text-to-speech.p3: Content creators generate voiceovers for YouTube videos or tutorials when recording their own voice isn't practical. Educators create audio versions of written lessons for students with visual impairments or reading difficulties. Authors listen to their drafts read aloud to catch awkward phrasing or pacing issues during editing. Language learners hear correct pronunciation of foreign words or sentences they're studying. Accessibility advocates provide audio alternatives for web content that lacks proper screen reader support.
text-to-speech.p4: Choose natural-sounding voices over robotic ones when available, though quality varies significantly by browser and operating system. Add punctuation like commas and periods to control pacing, since TTS engines use these cues for pauses. Spell out acronyms, numbers, and abbreviations phonetically if the voice mispronounces them. Break long text into shorter paragraphs and generate separately to avoid single enormous audio files. Test different speed and pitch combinations to find the most natural-sounding settings for your specific text and voice.

reverse-audio.p2: Upload an audio file and click the reverse button. The tool reads the audio data into memory, flips the sample order from end to beginning, and renders the reversed waveform. Processing happens entirely in your browser using Web Audio API, so files never leave your device. Preview the reversed audio to hear the backward effect. The result plays your audio in reverse chronological order, creating the classic backward-masking effect heard in experimental music and audio puzzles. Download the reversed file when ready.
reverse-audio.p3: Musicians create psychedelic or experimental effects by layering reversed vocals or instruments into songs. Audio engineers analyze recordings backward to detect hidden messages, edit points, or masking techniques. Sound designers generate eerie or otherworldly effects for horror films, sci-fi projects, or video games. Educators demonstrate wave properties and audio concepts by showing students how sound behaves in reverse. Puzzle creators embed backward audio clues in games or alternate reality experiences for players to decode.
reverse-audio.p4: Reverse your audio twice to return to the original if you need to undo the effect without re-uploading. For music, reverse specific instrument tracks rather than full mixes to create unique textures without destroying the entire arrangement. Combine reversed audio with reverb or delay effects to generate ambient soundscapes popular in lo-fi and vaporwave production. Export reversed speech to check if hidden messages exist in source material, though most "backward masking" claims are pareidolia. Use reversed percussion or cymbals as transitions or risers in music production, a technique common in electronic genres.

change-audio-volume.p2: 볼륨이 너무 작거나 너무 큰 오디오 파일을 업로드합니다. 슬라이더를 사용하여 볼륨 승수를 선택합니다. 100% 미만의 값은 볼륨을 줄이고 위의 값은 훨씬 더 조용한 녹음의 경우 최대 400%까지 증가시킵니다. 이 도구는 업로드하지 않고 브라우저에서 전적으로 처리하여 파형의 모든 샘플에 게인 조정을 적용합니다. 더 높은 부스트 레벨에서 클리핑이나 왜곡을 확인하기 위해 조정된 오디오를 미리 듣습니다. 레벨이 적절하게 들리면 볼륨 조정된 파일을 다운로드합니다.
change-audio-volume.p3: 팟캐스터는 에피소드 전체에서 일관된 청취를 위해 조용한 게스트 녹음을 호스트 볼륨 레벨과 일치하도록 부스트합니다. 음악가는 앨범 또는 재생 목록의 모든 노래가 유사한 인지된 음량으로 재생되도록 트랙 볼륨을 정규화합니다. 전화 녹음기는 방 건너편이나 시끄러운 환경에서 캡처한 먼 음성 메모를 증폭합니다. 오디오 편집자는 청취자 피로나 스피커 왜곡을 유발하는 지나치게 큰 섹션을 줄입니다. 콘텐츠 제작자는 배경 음악 볼륨을 대화와 일치시켜 비디오 사운드트랙에서 어느 요소도 다른 요소를 압도하지 않도록 합니다.
change-audio-volume.p4: 200% 이상 볼륨을 부스트할 때 클리핑을 조심하세요. 왜곡된 피크 또는 최대 진폭에서 평탄화된 파형으로 표시됩니다. 동적 범위를 파괴하지 않도록 편집 소프트웨어를 사용하여 먼저 오디오를 정규화한 다음 볼륨 조정으로 미세 조정하세요. 다이내믹에 영향을 주지 않고 더 간단한 음량 제어가 필요한 경우 압축 대신 볼륨 감소를 적용하세요. 음성의 경우 팟캐스트 표준의 경우 -16dB LUFS로 또는 방송 사양의 경우 -14dB로 부스트하세요. 특히 저품질 소스 녹음에서 전문적인 결과를 위해 볼륨 조정을 EQ 또는 노이즈 감소와 결합하세요.

word-counter.p2: Type or paste your text into the input box and watch real-time statistics update automatically: total words, characters with and without spaces, sentences, and paragraphs. The tool parses your content using JavaScript string analysis, counting whitespace-delimited tokens as words and punctuation-terminated sequences as sentences. Results appear instantly without requiring any button clicks. Use the stats to verify document meets length requirements or track writing progress. All processing happens locally in your browser.
word-counter.p3: Students verify essays meet minimum word count requirements for assignments before submission to avoid grade penalties.
